text: hi everyone Anthony Fantana here the
Internet's busiest music nerd and it's
time for a review of the new white
hinterland record baby this is the
musical project and band of
multi-instrumentalist singer songwriter
Casey day who is on her third
full-length record with this group and
album that really came out of left field
for me sort of surprised me I wasn't
expecting to hear a record that I
connected with so much on so many levels
from this band because to tell you the
truth there wasn't much from white
hinterlands back catalogue that really
caught my attention their debut slipped
under my radar and came out before I
even had a youtube channel where I did
this and the project sophomore
full-length LP Kairos was a little too
ethereal for my taste just an indie
tronic record that they just laid it on
a little too heavy with the reverb but
no matter now we have this third
full-length LP and I'm assuming that
since Kairos came out in 2010 that this
album has kind of been four years in the
making and I wouldn't be surprised if
that was in fact the case because the
detail really shows the quality of the
songwriting really explosive hooks and
moving ballads all over this thing as
well as the instrumentals which are
incredibly detailed layered and Casey's
really stunning singing and voice all
over this album I think Casey is one of
the most passionate and impressive
singers that you can lend your ear to
this year and I think Casey's influences
tend to run a little diverse to some of
the more strict back piano ballads on
here sound a little bit like Amos or
Apple and some of the more production
intensive tracks that feel a lot more
electronic in sound occasionally give
off a Bjork sound like homogenic
Vespertine Bjork and while these sonic
influences are very clearly there Casey
does come through with a wholly
different voice KC's immense talent and
winding linear songs really steal my
attention away from whoever shadow she
might be standing in on a given track
like with the song ringing the bell
which to me seems like a bus
lovesong looking to pick a relationship
back up from a point where it seems to
have broken apart and the hopes the
dreams the aspirations for this move
this decision all ring out beautifully
in Casey's voice the rich multitrack
horns blaring away in the background the
very pretty background vocals there's a
really nimble bassline darting and
weaving through all of these sounds
hidden in the background there's a
little detail to eat up in nearly every
instrumental on this record every time I
listen through this thing but Casey and
her band don't lose energy and and
viscera in the process of putting
together this very particular set of
sounds I also love the segues and the
transitions that white hinterland comes
up with to move a track from one point
to another and this track rides a really
interesting groove too as well as many
other songs on here while I do think
there is an element of pop and an
element of accessibility to this record
a strong element of beauty that comes
through in the instrumentation and the
vocals this is music that definitely
walks to the beat of a different drum a
different drum than just your normal
average pop tune like with the song baby
where Casey's voices is slowed down a
lot more her her singing is much more
emotive and drawn-out this is another
relationship centric track with some
pretty telling lyrics about how her
shyness was an act to give this person a
sense of security and the
instrumentation on this track is pretty
chilly - I can see my breath when I'm
listening to this thing I love the
really dreary and strange vocal
harmonies on this thing that wearing
high hats there's a really nice murky
bass line that's heavy it kicks the
track off sets a very dark tone and then
there's like a surprise transition at
the midway point where all of a sudden
the song really starts to warm up
there's some insane vocal harmonies at
this point in the track it really feel
excites the instrumentation there is a
stellar refrain is this my weakness
then there is the song metronome which i
think is is possibly the catchiest most
straightforward song on this entire LP
although it is just as layered and as
thick as many other songs on here
there's all these cycling background
vocals creating a foundation for the
track and these repeat again again again
it kind of reminds me of like an animal
collective track or something but what
Casey does what this foundation is is
very much different I mean she really
rides over this and and brings some
up-tempo piano rock there's a surprise
transition in the middle of this song -
Casey really keeps me on my toes with
all the surprises that these songs hold
but the very smooth kind of easygoing
piano ballets catch my ear on this thing
- like the song wait until dark the
opening track on here a song that is
really somber in tone
Casey's voice sounds fantastic she sings
so wonderfully over the pianos on this
track and she transitions right into
some very lumbering piano arpeggios just
those bass e heavy notes sound great and
I love how when Casey really strips back
the instrumentation she feels the need
to change things up with the song
structure even more it's like she can go
wherever she pleases without all of
these people playing with her because
she's just really in control of the flow
of the track the song David is a bit
more straightforward and is like so
close to get me all teared up it opens
up at this stunning lyric about how she
doesn't believe in God or chance or fate
when it comes to what her and this
person have together while
instrumentally and in vocally this song
as well as the closer on here do
exemplify some of those typical slow
burner piano ballad cliches I still feel
that these very familiar troops don't
take away from the quality of the song
or the singing definitely as far as
downsides on this record there are
tracks on here like no devotion or dry
mind whose beats I might be very
impressed with but I'm not that into the
pacing of the song I feel like with how
much Casey weighs these tracks down in
sound and in detours the songs 10
to kind of lose their appeal and overall
I loved listening to this thing I think
Casey has a really great assembly of
tracks on this record she shows some
real vocal chops some piano chops
there's a strong lyrical component to
nearly every track here while I wouldn't
call this thing a concept album many of
these songs do seem to be relationship
centric I'm loving the creative
instrumentals on this thing the
adventurer's song structures just how
beautiful so many moments on this record
are I'm feeling the light a decent eight
on this thing Tran vision what did you
think of this new white hinterland album
did you love it hate it why and what
should Anthony review next white
hinterland baby forever
